Key Arguments: The bill represents government overreach and threatens democracy.
It will suppress free speech and stifle political debate.
The definition of misinformation is too broad and biased towards government narratives.
The bill exempts government and approved entities from being labeled as sources of misinformation.
It violates human rights related to freedom of expression.
The government has previously misled the public, particularly regarding COVID-19 information.
Notable Quotes: This bill is an extraordinary example of government overreach and, if this bill goes through, public health safety, electoral integrity, social cohesion and ultimately democracy will be at risk.
They will outsource censorship to the digital platforms so the government can dishonestly pretend that it is not the one ordering the censoring.
The government was completely wrong about the COVID-19 'vaccines'. They did not reduce transmission. They were not safe; they injured people.
Instead of a censorship bill Australia needs a First Amendment to protect free speech rights for every Australian.
